means: 宿醉（酒后醒来的头痛和不舒服）
遗留的感觉（或风俗、习惯等）

sentence.Network_en: As a hangover from rationing, they mixed butter and margarine.
sentence.Network_cn: 作为食品配给制的一种遗留影响，他们总把黄油和人造黄油混在一起吃。

sentence.Network_en: He appeared at breakfast bleary-eyed and with a hangover.
sentence.Network_cn: 他吃早餐时两眼迷糊，宿醉未醒。

sentence.Network_en: She woke up with a terrible hangover.
sentence.Network_cn: 她醒来时宿醉反应很厉害。

encyclopedia.content: 基本信息 中文片名：宿醉 英文片名：The Hangover 原文片名：The Hangover 国家地区：美国 影片类型：喜剧 分 级：R 上映时间：2009年06月12日 影片公司：华纳兄弟 Warner Bros. 导 演：托德·菲利普斯 Todd Phillips 编 剧：丘·卢卡斯Jon Lucas 斯考特·莫瑞Scott Moore 主 演：布莱德利·库珀 Bradley Cooper 海瑟·格拉汉姆 Heather Graham 杰弗里·塔伯 Jeffrey Tambor 贾森汀·巴尔萨 Justin Bartha剧情 还有两天道格就要结

entry.def: If someone wakes up with a hangover, they feel sick and have a headache because they have drunk a lot of alcohol the night before.
Something that is a hangover from the past is an idea or way of behaving which people used to have in the past but which people no longer generally have.

example.ex: As a hangover from rationing, they mixed butter and margarine.
example.tran: 作为食品配给制的一种遗留影响，他们总把黄油和人造黄油混在一起吃。

means.word_mean: 1. disagreeable aftereffects from the use of drugs (especially alcohol)
2. an official who remains in office after his term
3. something that has survived from the past;

means.word_mean: 宿醉(酒后醒来的头痛和不舒服)

sentences.en: I had one hell of a hangover the next morning.
sentences.cn: 第二天早上宿醉让我难受死了。

sentences.en: He had a hangover, so he ordered a sandwich to settle his stomach.
sentences.cn: 他有一点儿宿醉，所以点了三明治让胃舒服一点。

sentences.en: He’s still sleeping off yesterday’s hangover.
sentences.cn: 他还在睡觉消除昨天的宿醉呢。

sentences.en: ‘Why are you drinking whisky at 8 o’clock in the morning?’ ‘Hair of the dog.I’ve got the most terrible hangover.
sentences.cn: ’ “你干吗早上8点喝威士忌?”“解宿醉,从来没有酒后这么难受过。”
